title: Patient Name
instruction: Extract the patientâ€™s full name exactly as it appears in the transcript.

title: Chief Complaint
content: Evaluation of left wrist pain and masses.
instruction: Provide only the patient's chief complaint.

title: HPI Spencer
content: A 45-year-old right-hand dominant social worker presents with left wrist pain and masses. The pain is constant, waking her at night, and is more bothersome than the masses. She reports two masses: one at the dorsal radial aspect of her left wrist and another at the dorsal ulnar aspect of her left thumb MCP joint. These masses have been constant in size. She was evaluated by a rheumatologist who performed X-rays and an ultrasound of her wrist.
instruction: Summarize HPI with onset, duration, location, severity, treatments, and progression.

title: Musculoskeletal
content: Left upper extremity skin is clean, dry, and intact. A pea-sized mass is present over the first dorsal compartment, non-tender and mobile. Another mass is located at the dorsal ulnar aspect of the thumb MCP joint, non-mobile and minimally tender. Excellent range of motion at the thumb MCP with no tenderness at the A1 point, locking, or catching.
instruction: Extract physical exam findings related to musculoskeletal system verbatim.

title: Imaging Results
content: X-rays show an osteophyte at the thumb MCP joint. Ultrasound demonstrates a bony avulsion fragment versus osteophyte at the dorsal aspect of the MCP joint of the thumb and a retinacular cyst superficial to the first dorsal compartment sheath in the wrist.

title: Assessment
content: Left first dorsal compartment wrist cyst

title: Plan
content: Recommend night splints for carpal tunnel syndrome.
Consider aspiration or biopsy of wrist mass.
instruction: List treatments, therapies, medications, imaging, education, or follow-up instructions.
